docs.lead_paragraph: When Edward M. Liddy was named as the American International Group's new chief executive Tuesday night, part of the government's $85 billion lifeline to the beleaguered insurance giant, among the first of his tasks was reassuring employees that their company would survive.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve, the European Central Bank, the Bank of Japan and other central banks significantly escalated the assistance offered to global money markets on Thursday, coordinating efforts to ease monetary constraints stemming from the turmoil emanating from Wall Street, The New York Times's Matthew Saltmarsh reported on Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A day after the Fed's stunning takeover of American International Group, its new managers began contemplating a breakup of the insurer's far-flung empire and selling it off in coming months, The New York Times's Mary Williams Walsh reported.

headline.main: A.I.G. Starts to Calculate a Measured Sell-Off

docs.abstract: A day after the Fed's stunning takeover of American International Group, its new managers began contemplating a breakup of the insurer's far-flung empire and selling it off in coming months, The New York Times's Mary Williams Walsh reported.
